decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and card advantage with cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Manamorphose, while using spells like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual to cast powerful combo spells like Grapeshot. The goal is to assemble the pieces needed for a lethal storm count, using Gifts Ungiven to search for key combo pieces like Past in Flames and Grapeshot. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and finish them off with a massive storm count, effectively winning the game in a single turn.

This Aggro Jund deck focuses on disruption and removal to control the game while utilizing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. With a mix of discard spells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily building up its board presence to overwhelm the opponent. The deck's mana base ensures consistent access to its powerful spells and creatures, allowing it to maintain its aggressive tempo throughout the game.

This deck revolves around assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana, allowing the player to cast powerful spells and control the game. The deck includes various control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card draw, along with big threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up a strong board presence to secure a victory. The deck aims to control the game through resource management and efficient use of its powerful spells and abilities.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces necessary to win the game. By using cards like Ad Nauseam, Angel's Grace, and Laboratory Maniac, the deck aims to draw its entire library and win the game through alternate means, such as drawing cards with an empty library or dealing damage with Lightning Storm. The deck also includes some protection with Pact of Negation and Spoils of the Vault, while using mana ramp cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism to accelerate its game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cheap cards like Street Wraith and Burning Inquiry to bring out powerful threats like Hollow One and Gurmag Angler early in the game. By discarding cards and utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion, the deck aims to maintain a steady flow of threats on the board while using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper for additional reach and removal. The aggressive nature of the deck allows it to quickly overwhelm opponents and close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of burn spells, hand disruption, and token generation to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It aims to control the board while hitting the opponent's life total hard and fast. The deck utilizes Young Pyromancer and Bedlam Reveler along with cheap removal spells to pressure the opponent and maintain board presence. With a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful spells, it aims to chip away at the opponent's life total efficiently and effectively.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using a tribe of Humans. By utilizing powerful Human creatures like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Mantis Rider, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. Cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt the opponent's game plan while Aether Vial helps cheat creatures into play. The deck also includes disruptive creatures like Reflector Mage and Kambal, Consul of Allocation to further impede the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate massive amounts of mana quickly. It uses cards like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map to tutor for the Tron lands. The deck aims to control the board through cards like Oblivion Stone and Walking Ballista while also using powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provide additional control and removal options. The deck's ultimate goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and control elements.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle with Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent in a single turn. It uses ramp spells like Search for Tomorrow and Farseek to accelerate mana production and find key combo pieces, while also running removal like Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods to control the board. Prismatic Omen ensures all lands produce red mana for Valakut triggers, making it easier to reach the critical mass of lands needed for the combo to go off.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to out-value the opponent. By disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Path to Exile, Cryptic Command, and Supreme Verdict, while also drawing cards and generating advantage through cards like Serum Visions and Search for Azcanta, the deck aims to slowly grind out a win condition. Cards like Celestial Colonnade and Gideon of the Trials provide win conditions, while Spreading Seas and Field of Ruin disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck plays a slow and patient game, gradually gaining control and overwhelming the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana. This allows the player to cast creatures from their hand using Chord of Calling or Collected Company to find specific creatures needed for the situation, creating a "toolbox" of creatures. The deck also includes cards like Kitchen Finks and Eternal Witness for value, while cards like Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit and Gavony Township provide additional synergy and support for the combo. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a versatile and resilient creature-based strategy.

The core idea of this Aggro Goblin deck is to swarm the opponent with low-cost, fast creatures while utilizing burn spells and Blood Moon to disrupt their mana base. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence with cards like Goblin Guide and Legion Loyalist, then finish off the opponent with cards like Goblin Grenade and Goblin Bushwhacker. The inclusion of Mutavault allows for additional creature threats, while Foundry Street Denizen benefits from the constant stream of Goblin creatures entering the battlefield. Overall, the strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn damage.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently play aggressive Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher as early as possible by utilizing mana acceleration cards like Serum Powder and Simian Spirit Guide. Chalice of the Void and Key to the City provide disruption and card advantage, while cards like Eternal Scourge and Matter Reshaper provide value in the mid to late game. With Eldrazi Mimic and Endless One rounding out the creature base, along with utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Tectonic Edge, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful threats and disruptive capabilities.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Worldspine Wurm and Griselbrand, and then use reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to bring them back into play for a devastating combo. Cards like Through the Breach and Nourishing Shoal help to cheat these creatures into play early, while Simian Spirit Guide and Desperate Ritual provide additional mana for explosive turns. The deck is built around fast, explosive plays and aims to win the game through the sheer power of its reanimated threats.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast Primeval Titan and search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. By using cards like Farseek, Search for Tomorrow, and Sakura-Tribe Elder, the deck aims to summon Primeval Titan and use its abilities to put Valakut into play and trigger it multiple times in a turn. Cards like Through the Breach and Summoner's Pact are also included to help with getting Primeval Titan onto the battlefield quickly. The ultimate goal is to deal massive damage to the opponent with Valakut triggers and win the game.

This UR control deck focuses on disruption and protection before ultimately casting Emrakul, the Aeons Torn with Through the Breach or protecting the late game with counterspells. The deck uses cards like Remand, Spell Snare, and Cryptic Command to control the pace of the game, while also utilizing Lightning Bolt and Electrolyze for removal. The deck also includes card draw with Serum Visions and Pull from Tomorrow, and utilizes Snapcaster Mage to recast key spells. Blood Moon provides additional disruption against opponent's mana bases.
